OrganizationFormalName: National Park Service Water Resources Division
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: Site 1C: Pelican Creek.  Start just east of Pelican Creek and work east along the shore.  Watch out for the sand bar coming off of the creek mouth.  These nets get hit hard by the wind so make sure you have enough weight attached, small 5lbs. won't do the trick.  550795 Easting     4933237 Northing

OrganizationFormalName: National Park Service Water Resources Division
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: Site 2A: Lake Outlet.  Start just west of Yellowstone River outlet by old sewage hut (small brown building on shore in small patch of trees) and work west toward Ranger Station and convenience store.  These nets get hit hard by the wind so make sure you have enough weight attached, small 5lbs. won't do the trick.  548839 Easting     4933675 Northing

OrganizationFormalName: National Park Service Water Resources Division
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: Site 2B: Boathouse.  Start 100 meters west of old boathouse and work west towards marina.  547131 Easting     4932930 Northing

OrganizationFormalName: National Park Service Water Resources Division
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: Site 3A: Sand Point.  Start just north of Sand Point and work north along the shoreline.  This area drops off quickly.  Make sure to have 40 meter float lines for the deep ends.  These sets are usually set at a 45-degree angle to the shore.  Make sure shallow ends have enough weight so nets don't roll down the drop-off.  546869 Easting     4926854 Northing

OrganizationFormalName: National Park Service Water Resources Division
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: Site 4A: Arnica Creek.  Start just south of Arnica Creek (may  not be connected to lake but is just west of hard road to travel) and work west along high bank.  536555 Easting     4924293 Northing

OrganizationFormalName: National Park Service Water Resources Division
MonitoringLocationName: Yellowstone River at Artist Point Bridge
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: The watershed of the Yellowstone River at Artist Point includes much of the central and southern portions of Yellowstone National Park and portions of Teton National Forest.  The site is approximately 19.3 km from the north end of Yellowstone Lake and is located midway on the bridge that crosses the Yellowstone River just upstream of the upper and lower falls.
HorizontalCollectionMethodName: GPS Code (Pseudo Range) Standard Position (SA Off)

OrganizationFormalName: National Park Service Water Resources Division
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: The watershed of the Yellowstone River at Fishing bridge includes much of the southeastern part of Yellowstone National Park and drains approximately 256,667.8 hectares of pristine forest and alpine meadows.  The sample location is in the vicinity of Lake Village and just north of Yellowstone Lake near the lake outlet at a USGS gaging station.
HorizontalCollectionMethodName: GPS Code (Pseudo Range) Standard Position (SA Off)
VerticalCollectionMethodName: GPS Code (Pseudo Range) Standard Position (SA Off)

OrganizationFormalName: National Park Service Water Resources Division
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: Station 24 is located in the West Thumb portion of Yellowstone Lake along the western shoreline near the vicinity of Carrington Island.

OrganizationFormalName: National Park Service Water Resources Division
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: This site is located in the West Thumb portion of Yellowstone Lake along the northwest shoreline and approximately 2 km north of Carrington Island.  It lies within region 1 of Yellowstone Lake distribution netting.

OrganizationFormalName: National Park Service Water Resources Division
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: This site is located along the north shoreline of the West Thumb portion of Yellowstone Lake.

OrganizationFormalName: National Park Service Water Resources Division
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: This station is located in the West Thumb portion of Yellowstone Lake and within Region 1.  It is approximately 1 km west of Pumice Point in the north shore of West Thumb.

OrganizationFormalName: National Park Service Water Resources Division
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: This site is located in the Breeze Channel portion of Yellowstone Lake in region 2.  It is on the north shore of the channel approximately midway between Pumice and Rock points.

OrganizationFormalName: National Park Service Water Resources Division
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: This site is located in Region 3 of Yellowstone Lake along the west shoreline near Sand Point

OrganizationFormalName: National Park Service Water Resources Division
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: This site is located within the main basin of Yellowstone Lake within region 3.  it is located along the western shore approximately 2 km north of Sand Point.

OrganizationFormalName: National Park Service Water Resources Division
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: This site is located in the northwest corner of Yellowstone Lake on the south shoreline of the Bridge Bay area.

OrganizationFormalName: National Park Service Water Resources Division
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: Station located on north shore of Yellowstone Lake approximately 2 km from Bridge Bay marina.

OrganizationFormalName: National Park Service Water Resources Division
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: Shoreline KM 52 on the north shore of Yellowstone Lake approximately 3 km from Bridge Bay marina.

OrganizationFormalName: National Park Service Water Resources Division
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: This site is located on the north shoreline of Yellowstone Lake in the vicinity of the Yellowstone Lake hotel.

OrganizationFormalName: National Park Service Water Resources Division
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: This site is located on the north shoreline of Yellowstone Lake in region 3.  It is located approximately 2 km west of Mary Bay and 4 km east of the lake outlet.
